messages.content:
In the recent council election, the SNP were delighted to be returned as the largest party in Glasgow - ending decades of Labour rule at Glasgow City Chambers. As your new SNP Councillors get to work on your behalf, I know our new City Government will transform our city for the better in the months and years ahead.

As your SNP candidate for the Glasgow South constituency, I hope I can count on your continued support for the snap election on 8th June.

I was elected two years ago as the first ever SNP MP for the Glasgow South constituency and since then I have done my best to stand up for you in parliament and be a diligent local MP here in the constituency.

As the Prime Minister takes us towards an increasingly difficult Brexit, it is vital that our area has an MP who will stand up for jobs and workers rights, propose the nuclear threat posed by Trident and the worst excesses of this hard-right Tory Government the UK Government is pursuing.

There’s also another extremely important issue at stake in this election and that is the future of both Langside and Castlemilk Job Centres which the Tories want to close. Since the announcement last year, I have worked tirelessly with politicians of different parties, trade unions and community campaigners to help keep our Job Centres open and local. The election means that the decision has been put on hold until after polling day.

By re-electing me as your MP you will be making it crystal clear to the UK Government that their attack on Glasgow’s Job Centres is unacceptable, and my promise to you is that I will continue to fight these closures every step of the way. As the Tories look set to win a big majority at this election, it is vital you have an MP who can be relied upon to stand up for Scotland.

I have shown in my first two years that I’m not afraid to stand up for you and tell it like it is at Westminster. On the 8th of June, I need your support to help me continue this work.

My promise to you is that I will continue to be a strong voice for Scotland, for Glasgow and for the Southside.
